intro: Dysphania microcarpa, commonly known as small-fruited Chenopodium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its seeds are tiny and often dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize various habitats. Dysphania microcarpa is typically found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
